physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Right carotid showed focal uptake on 18F-FDG PET/CT indicating unstable plaque.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Doppler examination performed 2 weeks later found a complete occlusion of the right carotid by an atherosclerotic plaque. The patient then presented with left hemiparesis suggesting a right hemisphere stroke, confirmed by MRI showing a frontal infarction.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: MRI confirmed frontal infarction in the anterior cerebral artery territory.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Post-event PET/CT confirmed right frontal lobe infarction and persistence of the right carotid focus, with the patient conserving left hemiparesis.
